title: MOOC-Based Self-Directed Language Learning Program Design for Adult Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy, language education experience, foundational grammar comprehension, and text analysis skills
context.additional_context: Language educators in smartphone-centric, limited-tech environments develop self-directed learning strategies using MOOCs. Focus on enhancing learners’ writing feedback and reading comprehension strategies.

learning_goals: Classify ≥3 motivations for adult learners’ MOOC participation and connect them to language learning goals (vocabulary expansion, grammar understanding, expressive ability improvement).
Identify two major factors hindering MOOC completion in language education (e.g., lack of learning persistence, insufficient interaction) and propose integrated reading-writing solutions.
Develop a design framework for corporate language MOOC courses applying self-directed learning theory, incorporating an integrated speaking-listening assessment system

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
